strIntroduction: Go for a fun dive at the world renowned Ishigaki diving point (Kabira Ishizaki Manta Scramble), where you can have an adventure swimming through intricate coral reefs, arches, caves, and schools of manta rays! Ishigaki island is the most southern part of Japan, and with the gorgeous emerald ocean full of beautiful coral reefs and tropical fish, it's almost like an enormous aquarium!! The semi-tropical climate and calm sea conditions make an enjoyable dive all year round. **The 'Fun Dive' courses are for divers who hold a licence. For beginners, please choose our 'Introduction', or 'Discover' courses** <Basic Daily Schedule> 8:30AM Meet up at the dive shop. 9:00AM Depart to the diving spot by boat. -1st Dive: Coral reef (1dive course will go back to the shop 11:30) -2nd Dive: Manta point 13:00PM Go back to the dive shop. -Lunch time & Log your dives. 15:00PM Go back to your hotel. *Transportation service is available for one day course. (Reservation required) *Half day courses don't include Manta Point, please join one day course to see the Manta rays.
strTitle: Go for a Fun Dive with Emerald Ocean! - Ishigaki Island

strIntroduction: Lake Biwa is the largest freshwater lake in japan and has an area of about 670 square kilometers. Surrounded by mountains and fed by hundreds of streams, the lake is rich in fish and plant species. In this activity you can enjoy floating on Lake Biwa riding the Water ball. Water ball is a huge transparent sphere made by polyvinyl chloride. We can enter inside the ball and float on the water. <Schedule> - Take pics! - Ride on the Water Ball 2or3 people together and floating on the lake with the canoe. - Create a token board with souvenir photos, shells or plants. Let's discover Lake Biwa on the Water Ball! strIntroduction: Ishigaki Island belongs to Yaeyama Islands, Okinawa and is located 410km southwest of Okinawa main island and just 270km of Taiwan. Surrounded by coral reefs, this island has lots of beautiful beaches and scenic marine spots. In this experience, you can enjoy the beautiful ocean of Ishigaki by kayaking and snorkeling. Since kayaks are small, you can reach good unknown marine spots for snorkeling! If weather conditions are good, you can enjoy snorkeling on the edge of the reef, where seawater is most transparent and coral and fish are most abundant. Basic Itinerary: - Pickup at your hotel about 09:30 - Drive to the kayak launch point (30min) - Start kayaking: paddling to the snorkel point (20-30min) - Enjoy snorkeling! - Lunch time under the trees - Enjoy snorkeling and kayaking! - Drop off at your hotel about 15:00 Enjoy the beautiful ocean in Ishigaki!
strTitle: Enjoy Sea Kayaking & Snorkeling in Ishigaki!

strIntroduction: Kerama Islands are located 32km southwest of Okinawa main island. Around the Kerama Islands, there are over 100 attractive diving spots. Kerama are easily accessible by sea or air, yet they remain an idyllic and tranquil environment. Unspoiled beaches and transparent seawater provide you excellent conditions for snorkeling and scuba diving experience, even for beginners. Wide variety of coral reef and tropical fish can be seen. In this diving activity, you can enjoy swimming with Sea Turtle, and of course beautiful ocean of Kerama Islands. Sea Turtle is listed on Red List, designated as a endangered species. Japanese have had deep relationship with them since the older time, as they can be found old fairy tale story Urashima Taro. Here Kerama Island is one of breeding grounds of sea turtles. First time to try scuba diving?- don't worry, this trial diving course is for those who have not tried diving: PADI qualified diver will guide you to enjoy the diving experience! Schedule: 7:30 Meet up at Naha area (pick up available from Naha city hotels only) 8:30 Departure for Kerama Islands (Cruise) 10:00 Arrive at Kerama Islands Snorkeling to get used to the seawater. Lecture and enjoy trial diving - 2Tanks Boat dive (additional diving available for an additional fee). Lunch on the deck! 17:00 Return to Naha city Let's enjoy trial diving experience with sea turtles! ※Please answer the following questions on your past and present medical history with a YES or NO. strIntroduction: If you are interested in Japanese culture, kimonos and enjoying beautiful scenery in Kyoto, this experience will be perfect for you. We will provide you a very unique experience whereby you can wear a traditional kimono and shoot your wedding photos in Kyoto. Imagine being dressed up in a beautiful kimono while admiring an extraordinary view of cherry blossom in Kyoto. What an unforgettable memory for your marriage! This activity will take place in Gion- famous for its attractions such as its cobblestone street, traditional Kyoto Machiya, Tatsumi Shrine, and the Tatsumi stone bridge. Wandering around Gion feels like you're in ancient Kyoto. If you are looking for a place with a vintage atmosphere, Gion is the best choice! I will be your friendly English guide as well, so do not worry about Japanese being a language barrier to keep you from taking beautiful wedding photos in Kyoto. Note:we can take photos for your wedding party. Please contact us if you're interested in. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have questions! To see a sakura forecast and more cherry blossom tours in Japan, please check here: www.govoyagin.com/pages/japan_cherry_blossom Photo Credit: https://flic.kr/p/dYF5xM https://flic.kr/p/2cpuz https://flic.kr/p/xcoPw https://flic.kr/p/fsnQJ
strTitle: Shoot Wedding Photos in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Experience the practice of the traditional Japanese martial arts of Karate or Aikido in Aichi. Akido is a martial art with more emphasis on spirituality as compared to other forms of martial arts. The purpose of AIkido is to control your opponents by using the physical art of harmony. You will lead your opponent and control his movements without relying on your own physical strength, instead using his strength against himself just like dancing. Accepting the opponent without repelling him is the core of Aikido's technique. As it does not require much muscular strength, anybody can learn Aikido to improve your health regardless of age or gender. Karate is world-famous as a strike-based martial art. You will get a chance to learn techniques passed down from the predecessors of Karate. The essence of karate lies in wisdom of movement, and it is a reflection of your mental strength as much your physical ability. Experience a sense of Japanese values, mannerisms and customs through martial arts with this introductory experience.
strTitle: Practice Japanese Martial Arts Aikido or Karate.

strIntroduction: Enjoy stand-up paddle boarding on the beautiful sea in Ishigaki! What's stand-up paddle bording?: Stand-up paddle boarding is similar to surfing. You stand up on a long board and surf by rowing with an oar. With a minimum of gear, you can paddle ocean surf and rivers—no waves required. -Coral Reef Course For beginners. Enjoy Ishigaki's beautiful sea, paddling on a bigger board. Also you can go snorkeling at the coral area. -Tropical River Course Paddling in the river, where mangrove trees grow thick. You will love the beautiful view! -Wave Riding Course Intermediate. You will not soon forget this amazing experience, surfing in the beautiful sea in Ishigaki. You can also enjoy snorkeling here." Enjoy beautiful sea and SUP in Ishigak! Photo Credit http://flic.kr/p/exxxMw http://flic.kr/p/bWr4cD http://flic.kr/p/4NcmYr http://flic.kr/p/d6AYCG
strTitle: Enjoy Stand-up Paddle Boarding in Ishigaki!

strIntroduction: Iriomote island is an uninhabited rustic land where pristine nature stays untouched by men and urbanization. Here, you can relax in the forest of mangroves as you leisurely cruise by on your Stand Up Paddleboard (SUP). Take a bath in the powerful waterfalls of the outback and trek through unexplored jungles to see rare species of wildlife such as the Iriomote wild cat, an endangered species. In addition to the desolated beach, you can go on a snorkeling tour in a sea of emerald blue blossoming with beautiful coral reefs. You can also opt to go for a boat cruise tour, a surf trip, or canyoning tour through the valleys. A limestone cave entrance stands out majestically in the middle of the jungle. Join us on this exciting adventure through the unexplored jungles of Iriomote island!
strTitle: Explore Iriomote Island on a Stand Up Paddleboard!

strIntroduction: The Warring States Period in Japanese history was a time of social upheaval, political intrigue, and nearly constant military conflict that lasted roughly from the middle of the 15th century to the beginning of the 17th century. There used to be Samurai, Ninja and traditional warriors. They were divided by regions, fighting to conquer each other. In this activity, you will visit the cafe which replicates the Warring States Period with its decorations. You will see traditional relics used by the warriors such as Japanese traditional armors, helmets, scrolls, swords and more. If you have interest in Japanese tradition, culture and history, you can't miss this place! Photo Credit http://flic.kr/p/efbTgU http://flic.kr/p/72DVdK http://flic.kr/p/7aNTbY http://flic.kr/p/7HmKB http://flic.kr/p/9W4fSQ http://flic.kr/p/aGk9jV
strTitle: Reservation for Warring States Period,Sengoku Cafe in Tokyo

strIntroduction: As you know, Kyoto is the most traditional city in Japan. We still preserve Kyoto's architecture and cultures. Machiyas (Japanese-style house) and Sake (Japanese liquor) are our traditional icons, you will get a chance to know these things if you visit Kyoto. In this activity, you will visit a Edo Period Sake museum which is located in Machiya town. It is a building from the Edo period that served as a sake brewery. You will learn about Sake brewing and the history of a Machiya town house as well. The tools and machines on display that were used in for brewing are very well preserved and a guide will explain to you about the stories behind each item. I'm looking forward to meeting you, please visit us and learn about Machiya and Sake. Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/euJDk2 http://flic.kr/p/8U4B6B http://flic.kr/p/9qimS6 http://flic.kr/p/KBrpH http://flic.kr/p/4NZ3sd
strTitle: Visit an Edo Period Sake Museum in a Machiya House

strIntroduction: Machiyas are traditional wooden townhouses found throughout Japan, symbolic to the historical capital of Kyoto. This tour will cover: A Nishijin textile warehouse in its original condition: The Machiya originally operated as a money exchange house in Fushimi. But after the introduction of the wholesale system in Nishijin, it was reconstructed into a textile warehouse in the 18th year of the Meiji era, The Machiya is registered as a national cultural treasure, and is a classic example of a Meiji period large-scale storehouse. We are the 13th generation to own and operate the machiya. The exquisite details of an authentic Nishijin Machiya: The “Omoteya Tsukuri” style of architecture was developed in Kyoto, comprising a shop front and living quarters in the rear. The storefront faces the street, with the interior stretching far into the back. There are three secret storehouses and six small gardens which emulate the atmosphere of the four seasons, as well as a tea ceremony room and an annex where noh performances (a type of classical Japanese musical drama) were once held. Through these subtle details, we can observe authentically preserved Nishijin lifestyle. The original owner took great care in selecting the type of wood used to build the Machiya, and traveled to the mountains to hand-select the trees used to build the ten meter red pine corridor. The Living Machiya, merging Nishijin's history and lifestyle with modern times. Since the capitol city of “Heian Kyo” was founded in 1794, the people of Kyoto have lived by honoring the shinto gods. Even in modern times, the day begins by offering freshly cooked rice and spring water to each of the gods. “With god in our hearts, we show respect for all things.” This is the basic idea at the heart of preserving tradition in Kyoto. The owner has preserved this generations-old house as a way of sharing culture and hisory with the public. We hope that you will not only enjoy viewing the machiya, but also gain a deeper understanding of the “Real Kyoto” by learning about the traditional way of life. Lifestyle and culture are synonymous in Kyoto and we hope that through these various experiences you will be able to touch the spirit of the “Living Machiya”. Photos URLs http://flic.kr/p/3JTtwx http://flic.kr/p/3JXNAC http://flic.kr/p/5SbsdG http://flic.kr/p/55s1ky http://flic.kr/p/7X6GSm
strTitle: Tour a Kyoto Machiya and Learn about Traditional Customs

strIntroduction: This activity will begin at 8am in Sannomiya, Hyogo. We will start hiking on the beginner trail, a trail only locals know about which is suitable for all ages. On the way up, we will stop on pearl bridge for an amazing bird's eye view of Kobe and to enjoy the cool sea breeze from the ocean near the city. At the end of our trail, we will visit a cottage where many local hikers go to seek rest and food replenishment (such as Ramen and Udon). Our guests range from children to the elderly so everyone is most welcome to join us. Schedule of the hike: 8:00 a.m. Pick up at JR Sannnomiya station 8:15 a.m. Start of Trekking 9:30 a.m. Arrive at Pearl Bridge 10:00 a.m. Arrive at Mountain hut 10:10 a.m. Eat breakfast 11:00 a.m. Depart from Mountain hut 12:00 a.m. Tour ends at JR Sannnomiya Station Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/9CvJcy http://flic.kr/p/cjyV8Y http://flic.kr/p/8PNd3E http://flic.kr/p/6NTmAV http://flic.kr/p/8PNeZb

strIntroduction: It would be great if we can exchange our experiences or stories. I would like to talk to you about general topics such as job, hobby, culture from the point of view as business and Japanese women. If you are bored of traveling and ordinary sightseeing, this is a good chance to take a break and get to know Japanese culture from the local. I am looking forward to seeing you!
strTitle: Share Stories with a Japanese Woman Over Coffee!

strIntroduction: In this tour, we will reach the highest peak in Kyushu, Mt. Miyanoura. A lot of hikers love to climb here to overlook Yakushima, and this mountain is designated as one of the 100 most famous mountains in Japan - a country that is around 72% mountainous! At the peak, absolutely nothing will interrupt your view. You can see the horizon, nature, towns - everything in Yakushima. Yakushima is a round island sitting at the edge of the Pacific Ocean, and is covered in mountains, waterfalls, and sugi forests full of monkeys and deer. Sometimes you might even look down on clouds, and you can see the plentiful rhododendrons, depending on the season. I believe you will take home unforgettable memories from this very popular Mt. Miyanoura trek. Let us take you on an adventure both enjoyable and impressive! Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/af4tZ http://flic.kr/p/7dsYN2 http://flic.kr/p/7Z2zfF http://flic.kr/p/54EW34 http://flic.kr/p/7Wr9c6
strTitle: Get to the Peak! Mt. Miyanoura trip in Yakushima, Kyushu.

You will overlook the whole towns from top of the mountain, and the endless horizon makes you realize how this world is big. What will you find when you stare the huge rock? It will be memorable scenary. We will help you find adventure which makes you enjoy and impressed. strIntroduction: Come, walk along the Shirataniun river valley in the Yakushima UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you will find mossy plants wet and shining like jewelry in deep green nature. You will enjoy not only the depths of the primeval forests, but also the view from high up on Taikoiwa (plate rock). This breathtaking view from Taikoiwa allows you to see all the ancient forests of Yakushima. Let us take you on an adventure both enjoyable and impressive! Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/JVW5o http://flic.kr/p/77Jq1f http://flic.kr/p/fpzWRV http://flic.kr/p/JVWh7 http://flic.kr/p/acjuBJ
strTitle: Explore Shiratani River Valley in Yakushima, Kyushu

strIntroduction: Yakushima is famous for it's lush vegetation, and it's ancient Yakusugi (Japanese Cedar) forest has been a world heritage site since 1993. At it's heart stands the Jomon Sugi, Japan's largest conifer, estimated to be between 2100 and 7200 years old. It is said these huge woods have stood for about 7200 years, and have never fallen, even by wind or snow. These trees are so strong and impressive, they should never be ignored by travelers coming to Yakushima. Long trails show how long these ancient Jomon cedar have lived, and animals like monkeys or deers watch us curiously. Rivers of pure, clean water refresh you, and dense forest covers you. Who knows what you will feel when you see this unique primeval forest? The journey to the ancient Jomon cedars could be the trip where you can really find yourself. We will help you find adventure which makes you enjoy and impressed. Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/2KBucS http://flic.kr/p/77ELK2 http://flic.kr/p/2Kxb2r http://flic.kr/p/77EZp8 http://flic.kr/p/fGpJ28 http://flic.kr/p/6wTbdF
strTitle: Discover Yakushima's Ancient World Heritage Jomon Cedar

Kyoto is no exception, and in this activity, you will visit a local farmer in Kyoto to find out how vegetables in Kyoto are cultivated. We will pick some vegetables and use them to make home style meals such as Obanzai, a popular Kyoto dish, hot pots, and BBQ. Let's enjoy a day at a farm in Kyoto! strIntroduction: Take a break from metropolitan living by enrolling in this Japanese sutra-writing class in scenic Mount Hiei. The practice of writing sutra helps to calm and refresh one's mind, body and soul. Mount Hiei is a mountain north-east of Kyoto, located on the border between the Kyoto and Shiga prefectures. Participants will be writing sutras at the temple of Enryaku-ji at the top of Mount Hiei, which is also the first outpost of the Japanese Tendai sect of Buddhism.
strTitle: Write Japanese Sutra in Mount Hiei

strIntroduction: Shiborizome, is a Japanese term for several methods of dying cloth with a pattern by binding, stitching, folding, twisting, compressing it, or capping. Some of these methods are known in the West as tie-dye. The factory has more than 50 years of history in making shiborizome. You will learn the tie-dye technology and have fun while making your original pattern. Participants of all ages are welcome to join this activity. strIntroduction: In this activity you will learn how to make Yōkan, a very unique Japanese food that has been taken by Japanese with a long history. It is a one-of-a-kind experience that will surely make your trip to Japan especially memorable! Miso is a traditional Japanese seasoning produced by fermenting rice, barley, or soybeans with salt and the fungus kōjikin, the most typical miso being made with soy. On the other hand, yōkan is a thick jellied dessert made of red bean paste, agar, and sugar. It is usually sold in a block form, and eaten in slices. There are two main types: neri yōkan and mizu yōkan. "Mizu" means "water", and indicates that it is made with more water than usual. Photo URLs http://flic.kr/p/bgx9aH http://flic.kr/p/9TKy7 http://flic.kr/p/8EGET http://flic.kr/p/5ZnV4d http://flic.kr/p/aX5kmx http://flic.kr/p/c2EdqG
strTitle: Learn to create Miso and Yokan

strIntroduction: Tofu is a common component in many East Asian and Southeast Asian cuisines. There is a great variety of tofu, including fresh tofu and processed tofu, that is used in various signature Japanese dishes. In this activity, you will learn to make your own tofu. Following which, you can also taste the tofu you made. Join us for a truly unique experience during your stay in Japan! Photo URLs http://flic.kr/p/8xjK6Q http://flic.kr/p/6FVAuY http://flic.kr/p/9kBu9C http://flic.kr/p/9tXMVj http://flic.kr/p/8xgQCp http://flic.kr/p/8xgGcT
strTitle: Make Delicious Tofu all by Yourself!

strIntroduction: Tofu skin, yuba, bean curd skin, bean curd sheet, or bean curd robes,are all food products made from soybeans. During the boiling of soy milk in an open shallow pan, a film or skin forms on the liquid surface. The films are collected and dried into yellowish sheets known as tofu skin. Since tofu skin is not produced using a coagulant, it is not technically a proper tofu, however it does have similar texture and flavour to some other tofu products. Tofu skin was first documented in written records in China and Japan in the sixteenth century. It is widely used, fresh, fermented, or dried, in Chinese and Japanese cuisine. This Yuba making experience is conducted in a famous temple in Hiesan, up in the mountains. Monks from this temple have been eating Yuba over a long period of time. You will be able to make Yuba, and get to know about tradition and the long history related in this special part of Japan. You will have the chance to taste some of the soy milk that is made in that early morning. It is freshly made with rich fragrance of soy beans. You will receive instructions from the staff on how to make Yuba. Even an experienced staff member will need a lot of concentration in order not to make any hole in the Yuba. At the end of the day, it will be time to taste your own Yuba, prepared in several ways. Photo URLs http://flic.kr/p/aQU2DX http://flic.kr/p/9611h2 http://flic.kr/p/cbv1nU http://flic.kr/p/8Se7Jv
strTitle: Make Tofu Skin (Yuba) & Factory Tour in Shiga

strIntroduction: Guests will be able to see the brewing process of Japanese Sake. This local brewery is unique as the architecture and practices of the company reflects the local culture and traditions, unlike the bigger sake brewery. This Sake Brewery was founded in 1831, during the Edo period, and produces one of the best Sakes in Japan. Photo URLs http://voyag.in/1aIlRlo http://voyag.in/1eqvsht http://voyag.in/19SxTUY http://voyag.in/1aPNTdW http://voyag.in/1bM0hcL
strTitle: Visit a 182-year-old Sake Brewery in Shiga

strIntroduction: Here you can experience a day at a Japanese farm with many things to see and do. This farm is located at the north-east of Lake Biwa, the biggest lake in Japan located in Shiga Prefecture. Garden: There is a big garden spreading over 3,000㎡ with roses and native plants. Instead of intentional planting, the plants are left to grow by themselves while the garden is maintained carefully. This practice allows the garden to blend harmoniously with the rest of nature. There are also many detailed craft works in the garden besides flowers and leaves. It is a nice place for a stroll with the sound of birds and wind in the background. Blueberry Farm: In the 3-hectare blue berry farm, there are 3000 blue berry trees in 30 different species. Between April and August will be the harvest period. However, they bear white pretty flower in Spring and their leaves turn red in Autumn, giving it a strong seasonal feel. Vegetable Harvest In the huge vegetable farm you are able to harvest the best seasonal vegetable and eat them right away off our farm's own BBQ. BBQ There are BBQ facilities in the farm. We are providing a BBQ menu as well as giving you the opportunity to BBQ vegetables you have picked here. Playing with sheep There are about 30 sheep roaming in the farm and you are welcome to feed and touch them. They are tamed and friendly. This is a wonderful experience for children, and thus great for family vacations Vineyard Our vineyard is one of the few in this part of Japan. There about 11 different species of grapes and you may taste them to tell the difference between them all. Photo URLs http://voyag.in/19SvaL5 http://voyag.in/1efnEOK http://voyag.in/1dsGG8d http://voyag.in/Imuqr1 http://voyag.in/1aYd2Qc
strTitle: Experience Farm Life in Shiga

strIntroduction: This tour will bring you to the actual factory where Kirin Suntory beer is brewed, from its raw materials to its final product, ready to be shipped worldwide. You will be able to visit various facilities in the brewery to learn about the brewing process: “malting”, “wort preparation”, fermentation”, “maturation, “filtering” and finally “packaging”. At the end of the tour you will also have a chance to taste a couple of Kirin’s beer products. The tour is conducted in Japanese, with pamphlets in English, Japanese, Chinese, and Korean. It is also possible to have me explain the content to you in English. Photo URLs http://flic.kr/p/7mdn9j http://flic.kr/p/8ooX8L http://flic.kr/p/6n5LW http://flic.kr/p/9xFuwn http://flic.kr/p/7m9ttr http://flic.kr/p/6F5KmS
strTitle: Take a Kirin Beer Factory Tour in Shiga

strIntroduction: One can experience and learn the way of Japanese Swordmanship, then proceed to the skills of cutting apples in the air. In 2004, Joe Okada's first american student,Brad Knight made a new record on "Cutting the most apples in the air in 60 seconds" printed in the book of "Guiness World Records" No one else except him teaches cutting apple in the air in Japan, which holds all the essential movements of the Samurai Swordsmanship, making this an unique experience.
strTitle: Cutting Apples in the Air with a Japanese Sword in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Japanese embroidery (nihon shishu in Japanese) is an embroidery technique that dates back more than 1600 years. In its early stages Japanese Embroidery was only used to decorate items used during religious ceremonies. Over time, as shishu developed its own unique Japanese qualities and characteristics, it took on a more artistic purpose. According to historians, from the early Heian Period Japanese embroidery was primarily used to decorate costumes for the Ladies of the Court. During these early stages shishu was only available to selected groups; only the highest ranks of society could afford such costly work. However, after a thousand years' sleep, this cultural heritage, the fruit of countless predecessors, is now available to a much wider audience. This activity is for beginners to experience Japanese Embroidery. The design we are going to make will be a simple one that you can complete within the duration of the workshop. We will provide the needles, scissors, and all other materials you need for this workshop.
strTitle: Join a Japanese Embroidery Workshop

strIntroduction: Tour itinerary Kamakura is one of the most attractive tourist destinations near Tokyo. The ancient temples and shrines that are spread throughout the city are a must-see for tourists, but this course focuses on the southeast area where commoners resided in the days of the Samurai. Its many temples and shrines are complemented by a beautiful seaside location, traditional and cozy shops and a pleasant market. Its various faces make it an exquisite place to visit. Why not come to Kamakura for a nice walk through these unique spots? After riding on a bus for 10 minutes from Kamakura station, a panoramic view of the Pacific Ocean can be expected. Walking on Zaimoku-za beach, please imagine the days when this place flourished with merchants and artisans. At Komyoji temple, nearby the beach, a huge two-storied main gate welcomes visitors. The temple has two beautiful gardens – a dry landscape garden and a Japanese traditional style garden which was designed by a noteworthy artist 400 years ago. We can walk around the tatami-matted hall and have a close look at the Buddhist statues and arts. It is pleasant to drop in cozy local shops as well as temples and shrines while coming across surfers carrying a surfboard. In this area they suffered the damage of the Great Kanto Earthquake 80 years ago, but they keep their business going just like they used to be. Then we head for Ankokuronji temple, where Nichiren, one of the founders of a Buddhist sect, wrote his religious thesis in the 13th century. He is said to have chanted sutra on the hill in the direction of Mt.fuji every morning. From the hill visitors can enjoy the view of Samurai city, the Hakone mountain range and Mt.Fuji in a distance if the weather is nice. Let's take a break, having Japanese tea in the garden of the temple where various flowers are blooming throughout a year. Strolling along the tranquil residential area, we visit small temples and shrines and call in several shops for local people where you can appreciate traditional Japanese things such as Kimono or utensils for the tea ceremony. It’s available to experience wearing beautiful Kimono and have taken pictures by professional photographers (optional extras, prior booking essential). You will learn that Japanese people have been living with tradition and preserving it for a long time. The final attraction of this tour is a small but pleasant market selling local vegetables, fruits, bread and cakes. All of them are fresh and delicious! It's a good idea to buy them for lunch at the beach or to take home as a souvenir. Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/962r4S http://flic.kr/p/dB62pn http://flic.kr/p/76NEST
strTitle: Walk Old Capital Kamakura in Sea Breeze

strIntroduction: "Kawagoe", an old castle town, nicknamed "Little Edo (the former name of Tokyo)". Why don't you visit historic sites dotting the city and enjoy the beautiful townscape, with a well-informed tour guide in this area? The city of Kawagoe is a 30-minute train ride from Tokyo. It has a lot of cultural properties and historic sites which represent the culture of the Edo era (17th – 19th century). So you can enjoy an old fashioned atmosphere in Kawagoe and it is comparable to Nikko and Kamakura. Kawagoe had a close relation with Edo as a military base for the defense of Edo and a commercial base for transportation of goods and other materials to Edo. Since the Edo castle and its surrounding area lost almost all historical properties in the devastating earthquake in 1923 and the bombing in World War Ⅱ, the cultural properties of Kawagoe have become extremely valuable to recall the culture of old Edo. Japan has many towns and cities which call themselves "Little Kyoto", but Kawagoe is one of the three cities called "Little Edo!". As transportation is convenient, a day trip from Tokyo to Kawagoe is highly recommended. Without distinction of age or sex, everyone can enjoy a wide variety of tourist attractions of Kawagoe as follows: Hikawa Shrine Kitain Temple Bell Tower (Tokino Kane) The historic street lined by storehouse merchant house (Kurazukuri) The ruins of Kawagoe Castle (Honmarugoten) Small lane of tiny candy shops (Kashiyayokocho) Kawagoe Festival Museum (Kawagoe Matsuri Kaikan) Kawagoe City Museum Kawagoe Festival (held on the third Saturday and Sunday in October) Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/9KGHud http://flic.kr/p/JLsTV http://flic.kr/p/9KGHFj
strTitle: Enjoy Little Edo Townscape in Kawagoe

strIntroduction: Shogi (将棋 shōgi, generals' chess) known as Japanese chess, is a two-player strategy board game, the most popular of a family of chess variants native to Japan. Shōgi means general's (shō 将) board game (gi 棋). The earliest predecessor of the game, chaturanga, originated in India in the 6th century, and sometime in the 10th to 12th centuries Chinese chess, xiangqi, was brought to Japan where it spawned a number of variants. A 75 year old Japanese businessman, Ikeda-san who is the founder of a cram school in Kyoto since he was 16, will teach you how to play this famous game in his own cafe. He will also share with you his experience in setting up his business at the age of 16, when his wealthy family had lost all their fortune. His grandfather is one of the founding fathers of Ritsumeikan University, a famous university in Kyoto.
strTitle: Learn to Play Shogi chess with a Japanese Businessman

strIntroduction: Suntory is one of the biggest & most popular beer breweries in Japan, producing world class beers such as “The Premium Malt’s” that is being consumed and enjoyed world wide. Do you know such great beer is produced in Kyoto? This tour will bring you to the actual factory where Suntory beer is brewed, from its raw materials to its final product, ready to be shipped worldwide. You will be able to visit various facilities in the brewery to learn about the brewing process: “malting”, “wort preparation”, fermentation”, “maturation, “filtering” and finally “packaging”. At the end of the tour you will also have a chance to taste a couple of Suntory’s beer products. The tour is conducted in Japanese, with pamphlets in English, Japanese, Chinese, and Korean. It is also possible to have me explaining the content to you in English. [Meeting place] JR Nagaokakyo station (ticketing machine area) Or Hankyu Nagaokatenjin station (ticketing machine area) [When visiting on your own] You can take the free shuttle bus to from the train stations to Suntory Beer Factory. Coming from Osaka JR Osaka station ~ JR Nagaokakyo station (about 30min) Hankyu Umeda station ~ Hankyu Nagaokatenjin station (about 30min) Coming from Kyoto JR Kyoto station ~ JR Nagaokakyo station (about 10min) Hankyu Kawaramachi ~ ~ Hankyu Nagaokatenjin station (about 30min)
strTitle: Visit Suntory Kyoto Beer Factory Tour

strIntroduction: Woven on takabata looms since they were introduced from China over 1200 years ago, silk mon orimoro (design figures incorporated into the weave, itself), is exquisite, luminous, luxurious and multi-colored. The high precision and skill level required to weave this fabric, the resulting extraordinary beauty and quality demands that it be distinguished from ordinary brocade by giving it a distinctive name, Nishiki. In the Japanese language, the idiographic character used for Nishiki is a combination of the symbol for woven cloth combined with the symbol for gold, implying that the value of Nishiki is equal to that of money. In this tour, you will be visiting a 123 year textile weaving company in Kyoto that started their business in 1894. This tour is guided by the 3rd generate president who's grandfather was the founder of the company. The company is located in a traditional Japanese house in the Nishijin area which is world famous for textile weaving. You will be able to see grand pieces of work done by weaving, and all the replicas of old weaving machines used to produce textile pieces in ancient times. Some of the machines are also associated to the Shinto God, who is prohibited to be taken pictures of. You will also get a hands-on experience to work with one of the weaving machines to produce your very own textile piece for you to take home as souvenir.
strTitle: Visit & Experience Nishijin Textile Weaving in Kyoto

strIntroduction: In this activity, I'll find the best color that fits you based on your personality and body type at a cosmetic salon in Roppongi ."Personal Color" is very important for choosing clothes or make up - especially for Kimonos and dresses. If you choose the wrong colors, it gets difficult to accentuate your beauty. For ladies, I also give make up and styling advice. For men, I also teach you how to shape collars and choose a suit. This activity is best suited for English and Chinese speaking people who are interested in the latest Japanese trends or are interested in expanding their knowledge of a particular style. ※If you would like to join this activity with friends, contact me in advance and I'll make the proper arrangements!
strTitle: Personal Color Analysis at Roppongi

strIntroduction: What is the Japanese manner? What is the mind of Omotenashi or Japanese hospitality? Sado experience at the house of tea ceremony’s professor. Sado or the tea cult is the traditional Japanese way of drinking tea in accordance with set rules of etiquette and Zen ideas. Tea was imported from China in the 8th century. The nobility took to drinking it at lavish parties and later appealed to the samurai in the 15th centuries. Generally tourists take somehow casual tea and sweet at some hotels or tea houses of parks but with this tour, you can visit to the house of tea master. It’s very unique and valuable. Not only learning tea manner as guest from the professor directly, but also you can touch the utensils or learn how to make tea as host. The message form master is, “I hope all of you enjoy Japanese tea” Don’t worry, if you were not good at kneeling, they serve chairs. Every manner has each meaning. After this tour, you can be expert to Japanese culture. Except Saturday and August. Advance reservation is required. Meeting place is JR Kokubunji station of Chuo line.
strTitle: The Tea Ceremony Experience at the Professor’s House!

strIntroduction: In this activity, I'll take you to the Suntory Musashino Brewery for a visit. At the end of the tour, you'll be able to drink three glasses of cold fresh beer with snack they provide there.(Such availability of drinking service is based on by Suntry’s service as of September, 2013.) At the souvenir shop, you can buy beer or goods. I look forward to hearing from you!
strTitle: Guided Tour of The Suntory Musashino Brewery

strIntroduction: This is private tour for you, not group tour. In this activity, I will take you to a sake factory called "Ozawa Shuzo". strIntroduction: In this activity, accompany you to the Tokyo National Museum in Ueno and help you find out more about its history and culture. The museum is the largest in Japan and houses 87 national treasures as well as 634 cultural assets. You'll see how Japanese art has changed over time from the use of clay to the many Buddhist and samurai arts. As they say, "a picture's worth a thousand words" so, come and visit the museum with me! The price does not include the entrance fee to the museum. **You'll also need to pay for the host's entrance fee. Admission fee for museum: 620/adult, 410/college student Under 18 and over 70 – free You need to show proof of age or student position by identification such as passport etc. The Japanese garden with a pond, tea houses are so impressive from the balcony of the museum. Only limited times of Spring and Autumn is accessible to the garden by walking around. Usually Mondays are closed at museum.

strIntroduction: Why don’t you experience the esoteric Buddhism? “Kukai”, one of the most famous excellent monk, traveled to China in the 9th century and brought that to Japan. He also founded the school for the general in Nara prefecture. It is very unique to experience their “Goma” practice. The monks pray people’s wish to come true by throwing the wooden stick on which their wishes are written into the fire at the temple from 8th century. After getting oil to purify your body from monk, you enter the area very special. We can go into the fifth story pagoda and watch many small Buddha there and walk a little bit hillside area, imagining the pilgrims of ancient era. One and half hours. Entrance of treasure houses are not included.

strIntroduction: This is a special ranch 30 minutes away by car from Kobe. In this space, similar in layout to a Swiss mountain ranch, 23 hectares out of 126 hectares are open to the public. It takes 30 minutes from Kobe-Sannomiya by car, but there is a bus that runs between Sannomiya and this location, so you don't have to worry about transport. . You can enjoy petting animals on site, with many fun activities such as horse riding, milking the cows, feeding the animals and even chasing the sheep. You can even try to make handmade cheese and ice cream as well. Through this unique outdoor tour, experience the magnificent outdoors in Kobe, and feel first-hand what it's like to live on a livestock farm in Japan. strIntroduction: Japanese food has become popular all over the world, but still sushi or noodles dominate the menus of most overseas Japanese restaurants. This make it very difficult for most to imagine what an average Japanese person eats. There's actually nothing really fancy about a normal Japanese family’s home-cooked meal but that's what makes it so special. Take this opportunity to learn about Japanese food at a Japanese home. If there are any meals in particular you'd like to eat, let me know and I'll make it happen! ※Meeting Place Exit of Tokaichiba satation An express train does not stop at Tokaichiba station. After we meet up at Tokaichiba station, we move to my home by my car. ※Access to JR Tokaichiba station. -1hour from Tokyo station (transfer twice) -25 minutes from Yokohama station -15 minutes from Shin Yokohama station (the station Shinkansen stops at)

strIntroduction: Washi is the traditional paper in Japan. On this tour, you can try to make your own art on Washi. It could be your great stuff memorized in Japan. In this activity You will be able to learn several art techniques and millions of inspiration on how to capture your travel memory in a 30x30cm canvas OR a 2m long Washi paper roll to bring home. The facilitator will meet you at Azabujuban station / the studio. Please come with empty hands and a playful heart !

strIntroduction: Kumamoto castle is one of the most impressive historical castles in Japan. It was built in 1607 with the most advanced technology available at the time by the famous lord Kato Kyiomasa, and has been featured in many stories and tales over last 400 years. Today the castle impresses with its solid black figure and majestic appearance. In this tour a professional guide will lead you to the castle explaining about the history, the insides hidden rooms, and the stories that happened here during the feudal era. In addition, you will also visit the Former Hosokawa Residence, a brilliant and well-preserved samurai residence where the ruling Hosokawa family used to live. You will likely learn quite a lot about Japan's samurai history during this tou! Come with us if you want to feel 400 years of Kumamoto history!
strTitle: Take a Kumamoto Castle Site Tour in Kumamoto city

Maybe you'll see the boss hippo? You will be provided with a "Happy Travel Lunchbox", and Sachi Tabi Bento at lunch time. strTitle: Sachi Island Monkey Adventure

strIntroduction: Let's visit Nikko - the place of the World Heritage sites that includes the Toshogu Shrine, Futarasan Shrine, Rinnoji Temple and Taiyuin. Toshogu Shrine, established in 1618 enshrines Tokugawa Ieyasu, the founder of the Tokugawa Shogunate that governed Japan from 1603 to 1868. Its extravagant structures fascinate all visitors. You will see remarkable National Treasures, such as the three monkeys which “see no evil, hear no evil, speak no evil” and the “sleeping cat”, among others. Futarasan Shrine was founded by a famous Buddhist monk, Shodo Shonin. Here you can see Japan’s ancient mountain worship, because the shrine is dedicated to the mountain Nantai. Rinnoji Temple was also founded by Shodo Shonin. Sanbutusdo (the three-Buddhist-statues Hall) is worth visiting. Taiyuin is the mausoleum of Tokugawa Iemitsu, the 3rd Shogun and grandson of Ieyasu. It is less extravagant than the Toshogu. But its mysterious atmosphere will surely impress you.
strTitle: World Heritage Nikko Tour
